title.narrative: Results in Nutrition for Juntos SWAp

description.narrative: The proposed operation has been designed to support the demand, supply, and governance of nutrition services provided by the Government of Peru (GoP), organized under the Articulated Nutrition Program (PAN). The objectives of the proposed operation are to: (i) increase demand for nutrition services by strengthening the operational effectiveness of the Juntos Conditional Cash Transfer (CCT) program; and (ii) improve coverage and quality of the supply of basic preventive health and nutrition services in the communities covered under the PAN including Juntos. Activities to support both objectives include a strong emphasis in promoting good governance to monitor the impact of the Government Programs and of the proposed intervention in nutrition outcomes.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I: C | Description :The Borrower shall, when applicable, implement the Project or cause theProject to be implemented in accordance with the provisions of the Indigenous People Strategic Framework | Due Date :30-Jun-2016

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I:A (3) | Description :The Borrower, through DGPP, shall hold, until the completion of theexecution of the Project, the Regular Meetings to convene at least once every year, and shall submit the minutes. | Frequency:Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I:A (4) | Description :The Borrower, through UCPS, shall furnish to the Bank at least once ayear during the Project implementation, regular reports (the Regular Reports). | Due Date :30-Apr-2013

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I:A (5) | Description :The Borrower, through UCPS, shall, not later than December 31 of eachyear of Project implementation prepare and furnish Procurement Plan Reports. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I:A (6) | Description :To facilitate the carrying out of Part 3(c) of the Project, theBorrower shall enter into no later than December 31, 2011, and thereafter maintain, an agreement with INEI (the INEI Agreement). |Due Date :31-Dec-2011
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V: A | Description :The Borrower shall cause UCPS to hire independent auditors for theaudits | Due Date :31-Jul-2012

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V: B | Description :The Borrower through DGPP shall carry out jointly with the Bank amid-term review of the implementation of the project and following such mid-term review act to take corrective actions as agreed |Due Date :15-Feb-2015

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V: C | Description :The Borrower through UCPS should have procurement records reviewed andfurnish to the bank no later than six months after the end of each fiscal year, the procurement external review report | Frequency:Yearly

title.narrative: Number of districts in the first quintile where there have been discussion forums about CRED coverage and vaccines (social monitoring) and are registered on MEF’s web page
Percentage of mothers in Juntos families, with children under 24 months, who have attended at least to one demonstrative session inAmazonas, Cajamarca and Huánuco.
Percentage of health facilities with basic equipment to give CRED and vaccines in Juntos districts
Percentage of health micro-networks annually verified because they meet the certification criteria in Amazonas, Cajamarca and Huánuco
Number of newborns registered in SIS before 30 days in Juntos districts in the areas of intervention of the operation.
% of Children under 36 months that have received complete CRED scheme according to their age in the areas of intervention
Percentage of Juntos beneficiary children under 24 months registered in the Juntos information system (SITC) with birth certificate, identity document or CUI, and SIS affiliation.
Percentage of Children younger than 36 months affiliated to SIS and with complete and timely CRED scheme in the areas of intervention of Juntos in Amazonas, Cajamarca and Huánuco.
% of Juntos Children under 12 months that have received the complete CRED scheme according to their age in the areas of intervention of the Juntos CCT Program targeted by this operation.
Percentage of children born each year in Juntos households and registered in the SITC before 30 days.
Percentage of health facilities with updated and complete asset information in SIGA
